content.question: <math alttext="N O gas " overflow="scroll"><mrow><mtext>N</mtext><mtext>O</mtext><mo>(</mo><mi>g</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></math> and <math alttext="O 2 gas " overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>O</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mo>(</mo><mi>g</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math> react to form <math alttext="N O 2 gas " overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>N</mtext><msub><mrow><mtext>O</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mo>(</mo><mi>g</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math>. The rate law of the reaction is <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mi>r</mi> <mi>a</mi> <mi>t</mi> <mi>e</mi> <mo>=</mo> <mi>k</mi> <msup> <mrow> <mo stretchy="false">[</mo> <mtext>NO]</mtext> </mrow> <mn>2</mn> </msup> <mo stretchy="false">[</mo> <msub> <mtext>O</mtext> <mn>2</mn> </msub> <mo stretchy="false">]</mo> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@+= feaahqart1ev3aaatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLn hiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr 4rNCHbGeaGqiFC0pg9uqGrpepeea0dXdHaVhbbe9u8qqaqFr0xc9pk 0xj9qqaqFj0dh9qq=xfr=JarFfpeea0=as0=fs0di9uqFr0=vr0=vr 0db8meaabaqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaacaWGYbGaamyyai aadshacaWGLbGaeyypa0Jaam4AaiaacUfacaqGobGaae4taiaab2fa daahaaWcbeqaaiaaikdaaaGccaGGBbGaae4tamaaBaaaleaacaaIYa aabeaakiaac2faaaa@4689@ </annotation> </semantics> </math>. If the reaction occurs in a single elementary step that is a three-body molecular collision, then which of the following is the equation for the elementary step?

choices.label: <math alttext="N plus O plus O react to produce N O 2" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mtext>N</mtext><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.2em"></mspace><mo>+</mo><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.2em"></mspace><mtext>O</mtext><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.2em"></mspace><mo>+</mo><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.2em"></mspace><mtext>O</mtext><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.5em"></mspace><mo>→</mo><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.5em"></mspace><mtext>N</mtext><msub><mrow><mtext>O</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></math>

<math alttext="2 N O plus O 2 react to produce 2 N O 2" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>2</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.2em"></mspace><mtext>N</mtext><mtext>O</mtext><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.2em"></mspace><mo>+</mo><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.2em"></mspace><msub><mrow><mtext>O</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.5em"></mspace><mo>→</mo><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.5em"></mspace><mn>2</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.2em"></mspace><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.1em"></mspace><mtext>N</mtext><msub><mrow><mtext>O</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="N plus O 2 react to produce N O 2" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>N</mtext><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.2em"></mspace><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.2em"></mspace><mo>+</mo><mo>⁢</mo><msub><mrow><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.2em"></mspace><mtext>O</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.5em"></mspace><mo>→</mo><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.5em"></mspace><mtext>N</mtext><msub><mrow><mtext>O</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="N 2 plus 2 O 2 react to produce 2 N O 2 " overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>N</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.2em"></mspace><mo>+</mo><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.2em"></mspace><mn>2</mn><msub><mrow><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.3em"></mspace><mtext>O</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.5em"></mspace><mo>→</mo><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.5em"></mspace><mn>2</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.3em"></mspace><mtext>N</mtext><msub><mrow><mtext>O</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math>

skill.text: 5.E: Determine a balanced chemical equation for a given chemical phenomenon.
